main event: Two male civilians reported observing a round silver object flying overhead in Atlantic, Iowa, at 1000 hours on October 28, 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as circular with an estimated size of 5 to 6 feet in diameter., Witnesses observed the object rotating and emitting a gaseous substance while descending., The object flew straight and level, leaving no exhaust trail and making no sound during the sighting., The observation lasted for approximately 30 seconds before the object disappeared from view., A crude sketch of the object was included in the report.
sighted object: a round silver object in the sky
witness description: male civilians with a good reputation for honesty and dependability.
